Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a circular body and a rounded voluted nozzle. The sunken top is surrounded by a moulded rim; within are four incuse palmettes radiating from two concentric grooves surrounding a small central filling-hole; four subsidiary filling-holes are pierced between the palmettes. On the side, at a right angle to the axis of the lamp, is a pierced handle surmounted by a vulvate handle-ornament. Within the base-ring is a slightly curved mould-mark. Covered with a red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q576.bis)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr E H Walker
